title: ICE on illegal `macro_rules!`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

body:
``` Rust
macro_rules! a {
    ( $b:ident $c:d $e:expr ) => ()
}
fn main(){ a! (_ _ ()   ) }
```

I work on Windows 8.1 64-bit, rustc version:

> rustc 1.0.0-nightly (44a287e6e 2015-01-08 17:03:40 -0800)
> binary: rustc
> commit-hash: 44a287e6eb22ec3c2a687fc156813577464017f7
> commit-date: 2015-01-08 17:03:40 -0800
> host: i686-pc-windows-gnu
> release: 1.0.0-nightly

BTW, the same ICE occurred for my

> rustc 1.0.0-dev (e94a9f033 2015-01-13 14:21:39 +0000)
> binary: rustc
> commit-hash: e94a9f033eb79b3b4fb037722366644650e8e16c
> commit-date: 2015-01-13 14:21:39 +0000
> host: i686-pc-windows-gnu
> release: 1.0.0-dev

but it did not print backtrace with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` and I don't know why.
